source_article: "Vanguard ,2020-04-17,A member of the cooperative, who spoke on condition of anonymity, stated that the armed herders stormed the community at about 1am and started shootings sporadically. According to him, “they  stormed the home of the young man and his family members at about 1 am ,while they were sleeping and opened fire on them. “You know that because of the hot weather, people now sleep outside their houses. So when they stormed the compound they opened fire on the people, who they met sleeping outside, killing the young man and injuring others who tried to flee. “They are presently receiving treatment at the Benue State University Teaching Hospital, BSUTH, in Makurdi. READ ALSO: NSCDC Cooperative Society gets new executives “This is unfortunate because he was somebody I knew very well, a member of our cooperative society who was peaceful and hardworking, it is painful. When contacted, the Police Public Relations Officer, Deputy Superintendent, DSP, Catherine Anene said she was yet to receive details of the incident. "
source_headline: A member of the cooperative, who spoke on condition of anonymity, stated that the armed herders stormed the community at about 1am and started shootings sporadically. According to him, “they  stormed the home of the young man and his family members at about 1 am ,while they were sleeping and opened fire on them. “You know that because of the hot weather, people now sleep outside their houses. So when they stormed the compound they opened fire on the people, who they met sleeping outside, killing the young man and injuring others who tried to flee. “They are presently receiving treatment at the Benue State University Teaching Hospital, BSUTH, in Makurdi. READ ALSO: NSCDC Cooperative Society gets new executives “This is unfortunate because he was somebody I knew very well, a member of our cooperative society who was peaceful and hardworking, it is painful. When contacted, the Police Public Relations Officer, Deputy Superintendent, DSP, Catherine Anene said she was yet to receive details of the incident.
where_description: Tse Igba community in Mbabai council ward, Guma LGA, of Benue state

source_headline: Nigerian Troops Suffer Heavy Losses in ISWAP Ambush;#Nigeria;At least 70 soldiers killed in jihadist ambush in Nigeria;No claims;EXCLUSIVE: How Top Military Commanders Were Ambushed, Killed In Borno By Boko Haram Terrorists;Boko Haram Kills 47 Soldiers In Borno – Military;Gorgi-Borno attack: 29 soldiers, not 47, killed by Boko Haram – DHQ;Jihadist ambush kills at least 70 Nigerian soldiers
source_original:
HumAngle; Security sources; ISWAP; The Defence Headquarters (DHQ); "It was a huge loss, at least 70 soldiers have perished in the ambush," one of the officers said.

"The terrorists specifically targeted a truck loaded with soldiers with RPGs and incinerated the vehicle, killing all on board," a second officer said.

"So far 70 bodies have been recovered but the toll is certainly more than that as rescue operation is still underway."

Several soldiers were injured and some others taken captive by the jihadists, the two officers said.
